memory: Us driving together, and the tumultuous nature of the relationship (on again off again)
cause: The chorus is catchy and it's a great song, but the lyrics represented us very well and it's funny since we listened to it a lot late at night

memory: Sad memories
cause: The piano intro

memory: Being replaced
cause: Very sad, yearning tone, feels helpless

memory: The break up
cause: breaking up is the theme of the song

memory: The person that fits the topic of the song the most, and our relationship we had
cause: It was her favorite band while we were together
there's a line that says 'and i got a crush on the shape of your name on my phone'

memory: Reminds me of crying in my friends car screaming this song
cause: I think its the sadness and how he lowkey cheated on me

memory: crying in my car after a breakup LOL
cause: the song is about destroying yourself for another person and that is exactly what that relationship did to me.

memory: Beer soaked nights of singing along to this song in particular
cause: Good times that have passed and shall never return I.e late nights out with an individual who I likely will never see again

memory: Being sad and expecting someone to change and they don't
cause: Being calm in the beginning and then wanting to scream

memory: Something I could of said
cause: The lyrics and the beats

memory: His favorite song, dancing in my kitchen at midnight after cooking dinner
cause: I had never heard about it before he showed me. So every time I hear the lyrics I associate it with him.

memory: go fuck yourself
cause: Basically summarized the whole relationship perfectly

memory: I kept asking what their favorite song was and they finally showed me this one.
cause: The start of the song just rings a bell

memory: Reminds me of the feelings i felt at the time of heartbreak
cause: The part where it mentions that both partners are dealing w personal things and love cant always fix each other

memory: Face times and crying
cause: My ex and I made a playlist together while on facetime and that song was his top pick. When I broke up with him the playlist was on in the background and he sobbed.

memory: My ex girlfriend seriously loved Taylor Swift and I was made to listen to this song constantly. The main memory is that I got her a record of the album this song is on for her birthday and the first time she played it she made me sit and watch her do a full live performance of the song (and most of the other ones but this one was probably the most intensive)
cause: We didn't listen to that much music together but this song is so popular that I feel like it just somehow came on all the time when we were together. She also always made the joke that if we ever broke up I would be screwed because every time I heard Taylor Swift I would think of her, which is now true.

memory: How happy we used to be when we first started dating
cause: the beat and lyrics

memory: Listening to the song when upset right after a breakup, as well as seeing the song performed live once feeling much better about myself.
cause: The aggressive lyrics and tone of the chorus.

memory: Being ghosted and isolated!! I had a period of very unfortunate mental health and I was unable to get any support from my best friend at the time.
cause: The part about halfway through where he "talks to the audience" and criticizes relationships in general as well as (in my opinion) how they force people to conform and hide mental issues.

memory: Not knowing how to be happy without them and feeling like nothing was enjoyable anymore
cause: It's really just the words. The constant questioning of feelings and actions and if it's okay to be feeling that way or doing those things. It almost feels illegal

memory: It reminds me of my first serious relationship
cause: It reminds me how we kept trying to make the relationship work when it was obvious we needed to break up with eachother

memory: Her friends were always talking smack about me, and she broke it off cause apparently I didn't give her enough attention
cause: The lyrics

memory: There isn't one particular memory I think of when this song comes up. I just mainly think of that person and all the memories we had created together.
cause: The rhythm and patterns of sounds, if that makes sense. I don't think the lyrics have much to do about breakups, so it's definitely not the lyrics. Also, the person and I both loved Daniel Caesar, and we listened to his music together often, so I think the association of those various memories causes them to surface.

memory: The multiple times he broke up with me and thought that I would never kiss him again
cause: The lyrics

memory: When breaking started happening
cause: yes

memory: Feelings of melancholy and sadness as well as nostalgia
cause: The lyrics talk about betrayal which is what happened, and the softer overall sound of the song evokes sadder feelings

memory: What could have been
cause: Lyrics, beat

memory: It reminds me about the time I broke up with the dummy and hungout with him after n my friend was playing this song n it was pretty ironic n funny but sad.
cause: The lyric 'I don't care if it's toxic want your love and I need it now' in the song reminds me of how toxic he can be and causes the memories to resurface lmao.

memory: The sadness I felt after my breakup
cause: I didn't have a whole lot of support after my break up, so this song made me feel like someone cared about what I was going through and was looking out for me.

memory: Just memories of good times especially when being in the phone late at night haha
cause: When she sings it just hits a core feeling knowing relationships ain't worth saving if it's toxic and letting go!

memory: It was the first time I ever said 'I love you' to someone and my first serious boyfriend. Also we broke up around the time I first found the song so it reminds me of my first true heartbreak.
cause: I think the slow dreamlike feel of it of being in love for the first time. The first line 'I thought that I was dreaming when you said you loved me' always reminds me of how it felt to feel this romantic love for the first time.

memory: I think about how my ex showed me this song and put it on the first ever playlist they made for me. I remember how I felt the first time I listened to that playlist and that song. I also have a bad association with that particular band and my ex which makes me extra sad!
cause: its just such a nostalgic song for me and I look back fondly on the times when I first heard it. It's a really really dark and sad song but something about it is sweet and comforting

memory: Driving in the car on our way to various outdoor spots (camping, skiing, Rocky Mtn National Park)
cause: He was the first person to show it to me! And I didn't know anyone else who listened to that artist.

memory: Me realizing the meaning of the song weeks after he had dumped me - it devastated me even further than I already felt
cause: He showed me this song and put it in a playlist for our one year anniversary

memory: Failure
cause: "Choose life"

memory: the situation of why  we broke up and how i felt leading up to the break up
cause: lyrics

memory: Memories of my old best friend who was also probably my first love. Makes me sad.
cause: The line "I look up at the gaps of sunlight I miss you more than anything"

memory: The ending of the relationship when things stopped feeling right.
cause: The lyrics and the pace

memory: The constant bullshit that I faced towards the end of the relationship.
cause: Hearing Summer talk about the Constant Bullshit that London would tell her

memory: The messiness of my cheating, regrets and the possibilities that were foregone
cause: the tone and textures evoke a feeling of longing for something that cant exist anymore. And then longing for the end of that painful feeling.

memory: It brings back memories of me being there for my ex-partner during the tough times of their life.
cause: The lyrics directly correlate to how I felt once he broke up with me. I feel bad that his personal troubles were too much for him to handle on top of our relationship. Iâve always saw the best in him and wanted to help him get through those tough times, but even I could not help enough. I wish he knew how capable he was and how much I believed in him even though he did not have the same faith in himself.

memory: It reminds me of my first break up in high school, and feeling like I could only remember the good things about the relationship afterwards.
cause: The repetition of the line 'In my head' reminds me of in my own head I was for months after the break up

memory: Reminds me our times together and how things didn't work out
cause: The vibe and because he dedicated it to me

memory: Listening to this song on repeat with my friend after we had (within a few months of each other) left borderline abusive relationships. The song had come out only shortly before and it resonated with both of us
cause: The lyrics. It's a breakup song, but he's happy about it, because it needed to be done for his own sanity. This is the feeling you get when you leave a toxic relationships. We both knew it couldâve gotten so much worse but we didn't let it because we had each other to talk sense into us. It also has a club-like beat so it's easy to dance to!

memory: I really related to this song right after I broke up a long term relationship.
cause: It's about how a heartbreak is not something you can immediately fix. It's about learning to take it at your own pace and heal in your own time. That time in my life all I could do was reflect and be right where I was.

memory: Losing a love that I never wanted to end. I was moving to a different state, and I couldn't do long distance.
cause: The song came out during our breakup, and it talks about admitting to your love that the relationship you have together won't go as planned.

memory: I actually haven't broken up before, but have felt two platonic and one romantic heartbreaks. So these songs remind me of the reason for the heartbreak, for Boys Will Be Boys, it's due to me realizing my crush never liked me back, and the fact that it is best to move on.
cause: It is all in the lyrics.

memory: I actually haven't broken up before, but have felt two platonic and one romantic heartbreaks. So these songs remind me of the reason for the heartbreak, for Boys Will Be Boys, it's due to me realizing my crush never liked me back, and the fact that it is best to move on.
cause: It is all in the lyrics.

memory: I actually haven't broken up before, but have felt two platonic and one romantic heartbreaks. So these songs remind me of the reason for the heartbreak, for Boys Will Be Boys, it's due to me realizing my crush never liked me back, and the fact that it is best to move on.
cause: It is all in the lyrics.

artist: Rachel Bay Jones, Kristolyn Lloyd, Will Roland, Ben Platt
memory: I actually haven't broken up before, but have felt two platonic and one romantic heartbreaks. So these songs remind me of the reason for the heartbreak, for Boys Will Be Boys, it's due to me realizing my crush never liked me back, and the fact that it is best to move on.
cause: It is all in the lyrics.

memory: Listening to it with my ex in her apartment. Singing it together with me singing his part and her singing Taylor's. She showed me this song one night when we were sitting on the couch together. I think I was a bit anxious cause it was a divergence from the plan. Now, truthfully, I wish I could loop that moment.
cause: The piano riff. And the words of the chorus. And the section of the song that goes, 'so step right out, there is no amount of crying I could do for you.' Particularly the run on 'crying.'

memory: slow dancing in my childhood home back yard with only the phone speaker being held up to our ears at 11pm at night. being asked, very publicly, to homecoming as the song played over the auditorium sound system.
cause: i recognize the beginning of the song immediately. no matter how long it's been, i get a pit in my stomach the second i recognize it.

memory: The drive home from where we were when she ended it
cause: The lyrics, specifically, "Feeling capable of seeing the end. Feeling capable of saying its over"

memory: This was our 'song'- we saw them in concert together and we would listen to it a lot together. It reminds me of being super in love with my ex boyfriend.
cause: The lyrics and the memories of him.

memory: going back in time to change things
cause: generally sad, regret

memory: Driving my ex home after parties, he'd always play this song which was so soft and had such strong contrast with his outgoing crazy personality.
cause: "I'm a ghost of you", he still feels like a part of me

memory: it just reminds me of bad times mostly
cause: i used to listen to it a lot during the relationship, because it was our song

memory: Spite
cause: How much the attitude of the song changes from the original makes it hit a bit harder. I got led on and shit on by this psycho woman and when she had a freak out at me and lost her mind, made me sad for awhile until I realized I was tired of it all anyway.

memory: going to vermont with my ex for a ski trip
cause: it talks about vermont and lyrics are very similar to the way i imagine he felt when i left for school

memory: just reminds me of the guy the lyrics describe
cause: the lyrics are super literal and i relate to what the lyrics say about the guy the lyrics also quite literally describe our relationship

cause: the song

memory: Singing in the car late at night
cause: It's a silly inside joke and reminds me of the late night memories

memory: It makes me feel free & empowered to do whatever I please.
cause: Â«Â You don't own meÂ Â» is very liberating

memory: Reminds me of planning out a future with my last ex.
cause: The lyrics related to us and we would listen to it together.

artist: A R I Z O N A
memory: It reminds me of a time of anxiety and worry.
cause: The lyrics 'Not a single day when you don't cross my mind'

memory: Just being super happy and thinking about this girl that I was talking to.
cause: The lyrics, especially when she's talking about wanting to cry in a good way- I've felt that.

memory: It reminds me of the breakup in general. I listened to it a lot right after we broke up
cause: The memory of saying goodbye. We had a mutual breakup when I started college. We didn't wanna do long distance.

memory: Driving up to go skiing during the holidays with my ex.
cause: We would always listen to that song together so even though the song lyrics specifically dont relate us the situation does.

memory: This song remind of failed relationships, lost friendships, and brings up a lot of self reflection.
cause: The tone of the song and specifically the second verse.

songName: Alive with the Glory of Love
memory: He told me that he felt comfortable with me and that this song reminded me of him. Then when I went away to college he send me a picture of this song on his Apple car play in the car.
cause: The lyrics

memory: It reminds me of how everytime I was with my ex I always thought of how perfect he was, and yet how I didn't really feel like how I thought I should.
cause: Specifically the chorus, "He's everything you want, he's everything you need, he's everything inside of you that you wish you could be. He says all the right things at exactly the right time, but he means nothing to you and you don't know why." This chorus makes me remember how he and I were always a good fit and I looked at him like some prodigy, and that over time I resented that he was better at things that I wish I could do.

memory: The memory of being apart from someone close to me
cause: It is their favorite song

songName: 1990 was a long year and we are all out of hot water now
artist: jordaan mason and the horse museum, Jordaan Mason
memory: The last months of the relationship where things were falling apart and he was growing distant as well as the desperation of trying to talk to him while he either ignores me or simply doesn't respond.
cause: The lyrics are very explicitly about a divorced couple forced to live together due to a war (the album's concept is very confusing but that doesn't really matter). The song is also incredibly stripped down instrumentally forcing a focus on the lyrics. Jordaan's voice is also very emotive and gets the feeling of the lyrics across even if the listener didn't know the words.

memory: This song reminds me of how he blew up on me and called me 'a lot to handle' and 'too much' after I was nothing but grateful for everything he did, it just didn't work out, so I dumped him. Something he couldn't handle.
cause: The artist is giving her ex a nice f-u, which is how I feel about my own (and one to his momâ¦ something I would also like to say to her since she basically called me fat one time).  It was super popular right after the break up, so I heard it a ton when I was healing, and screaming it was a good way to let my emotions out.

memory: This song reminds me of the summer time with this guy I was in a relationship with, we were in Golden CO looking out to the continental divide listening to this song during golden hour, and he later told me that it was at a certain point during this song where he looked at me and knew he was falling for me
cause: The beginning of the song for sure, and also there is a lyric that goes "Safe is your heart, lover" and there's something about that line that strikes a chord.

memory: Sitting in the car with my boyfriend and him singing this song when it first came out. He just looked really good and idk why I just have such a distinct memory of his face and his voice.
cause: He was singing the lyrics 'and only have eyes and only have eyes for you' while looking directly into my eyes so every time i hear that song I think about that moment. ITS IRONIC THO because 'Kevin's Heart' is a song LITERALLY ABOUT CHEATING! And somehow it's the most memorable one I have with my boyfriend (he didn't cheat on me btw but)

memory: I attached this song to my past relationship. It was one of my first relationships in high school where all I wanted was attention but didn't know the difference between good or bad attention. Looking back at that relationship makes me feel gross and this song triggers the same emotions. The specific memory was, I was hanging out at a park with them and I told them that this song reminded me of our relationship (aka this song says I should be dependent on you so I will try to be dependent on you). And I remember the feeling of just wanting their approval of me.
cause: I had an unhealthy relationship and this song (in my option) shared a really unhealthy view on relationships which at that time in my life I thought was what I wanted.

memory: When I was 14, my first boyfriend assaulted me while this song was playing
cause: The entire thing. Within the first note I know what it is.

memory: I think about the day we broke up rather than our relationship
cause: One of the line goes 'maybe this thing was a masterpiece till you tore it all up' and that reminds me of the breakup

memory: I remember listening to this song on my drive home after we broke up, it also reminds me of conversations we had that preceded the eventual breakup.
cause: A few of the lyrics make me remember. Specifically, 'sorry's always better than a goodbye, keep feeling like we had this conversation'

memory: My high school breakup
cause: It was the song I cried to for about a entire month straight

memory: my ex dedicating it to me after we broke up. It makes me think about the simple happy memories we did have.

memory: My ex really liked this song, so it always reminds me of them. Mostly just reminds me of my dislike for them.

memory: My ex loved this song.
cause: I associate this song with her and knowing that she loves it, I just can't do it. Instant skip. I used to love the song too.

memory: I remember my ex, all the good feelings we had, and it reminds me of how special that connection was and how much I miss it, but I try not to even listen to that artist at all anymore.
cause: The melody is very calm and invites me in, but the lyrics feel very sincere and very similar to how I felt at the time, so it hits a hard soft spot.

memory: This song reminds of a time when I was completely in love and devoted to a single person. It makes me remember the vulnerability and trust I had with this person. It reminds me of looking in her eyes in a parked car and dancing in my kitchen.
cause: The lyrics. They way it's sang. I can feel the emotions the song is expressing and it reminds me of a time when I felt that way.

songName: A Sad Song About a Girl I No Longer Know

songName: All Too Well (10 Minute Version) (Taylor's Version)
memory: Betrayal, Crying in bed
cause: the fact that it's 10 minutes - feel overwhelmed with how long it goes

songName: In Case You Don't Live Forever
memory: It brings up memories of how the break up happened and how I felt during that time. I felt terrified, unstable, confused, anxious, panicked, and overall I was just in a really bad place as this break up was happening. The break up was messy. We were in a very unstable place, and weâd broken up once before. Then we talked and realized we had miscommunicated and misunderstood each other because of that. Then we tried again, but I was trying to rebuild while he was still deciding what he wanted as well as talking to another girl while telling me he had feelings for me. This song reminds me of how I was led on on top of the mental and emotional hardships I was going through, and the betrayal I felt by someone Iâd been vulnerable to.
cause: He showed me this song as a way to tell me he loved me. That I was meaningful and he cared about me. The song is sweet, and it just feels sickly sweet. It feels fake. It just reminds me of the betrayal and hurt of being led on. 'I love you' but he didn't.

memory: Very deep depression and extreme loss
cause: I performed this song at a music festival in highschool and it was pretty much the last interaction I had with this girl that was positive

memory: Searching the east coast for waves and surfing all day then getting out of the water after seeing a gorgeous sunset to get warm under a blanket with her
cause: 'Drive up the coast line stop by the shore to stare at the ocean. wait for a calling a call from the ocean to lead me away lead me away lead me away. Iâll fly over the mountains into the night sky on the horizon or dive into the ocean wherever you go I will follow you there waves crash on the shoreline kissing the sand the sign of devotion, stay stay in the moment surrender your heart and leave me away leave me away'

memory: It brings up memories of my post-breakup and the difficult emotions I felt afterwards. Listening to this song while biking or driving and processing the emotions.
cause: It's a fairly upbeat song, but I listened to this a lot after a breakup because while he wanted to part ways, I didn't want to. It resonates with me because it took a long time for me to move on and I kept waiting to see if it would take as long as one year and fourteen months to get over the relationship (which is the length of time the song mentions).

memory: feeling numb in my bed
cause: the vocals

memory: Memories of me needing more and they didn't seem willing to give it
cause: Taylor's Version of Red came out a month and a half after I went through a break up

memory: After the fact of the breakup(s), as it has remained as my main song for moving on with my life. It isn't about missing the other person but acknowledges how awful it can be. The main memory I have is singing it in general as a singer to direct my exes.
cause: "I am not afraid to keep on living, I am not afraid to walk this world alone" is a very powerful lyric. That and the belting backing vocals at the end just have a particular pain to them.

memory: Breaking down at 2am sitting outside shortly after our breakup, but I like this song a lot and don't relate it as much now.
cause: I listened to it on loop for multiple hours after our breakup

memory: Pretty much every time my ex would call me a liar or crazy. The biggest instance would be when I asked if he was seeing someone (he was) and he started calling me delusional and crazy and putting all the guilt on me.
cause: I think mainly the sad tone and the lyric 'you have broken me all the way down' really puts me in the mindset of how I would feel. Even though the song is slightly positive as it's about leaving a broken relationship, I only really think about the painful portions of the song (and the painful portions of my relationship). Especially the lyric 'when youâve missed every shot for me' reminds me of how the relationship felt unequal since, in my eyes, I would be the one to put in any effort while never having reciprocation. This song is also from a movie musical that Iâve asked my ex to watch with me and he refused so that's also partially why I associate those memories with it.

memory: Starting a fresh chapter

memory: All the girls be would typically date and how I would compare myself to them and stalk is following

memory: This song's lyrics remind me of an almost relationship that I had and how I still will always care about this person. It's a classic case of right person wrong time.
cause: First off, it's a really good song. I would listen to it in the car and all the time when I was thinking about this person and how everything went wrong; how I missed my chance with the person I will always love.

memory: My ex boyfriend would sing this to me in the car or play it when he knew I was sad. It helped me remember how much he loved me and how long he loved me for.
cause: I broke up with my first boyfriend two weeks ago. He liked me for over four years and sent me this over a year before we actually started dating.

memory: Buried memories of my long distance relationship with the love of my life. I love him dearly we broke up for given circumstances. But weâre still talking again. We actually started talking again just about 3 months ago.
cause: The lyrics of the song, the singers voice, it makes me feel like Iâm falling in love with my ex all over again. It makes me feel nostalgia, delusion, sadness, in love, everything at once while reminiscing the memories I have with the only person I think Iâll always be in love with even tho we broke up and he's far away from me.
